items.title: Verstappen wins to increase pressure on McLaren
items.summary: Max Verstappen dominates the United States Grand Prix to increase the pressure on McLaren drivers Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris in the championship.

items.title: Allowing Mbeumo goal to stand was tough decision but right one - Given
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given says that referee Michael Oliver made the right decision to allow Bryan Mbeumo's goal to stand in Manchester United's 2-1 win over Liverpool in the Premier League.

items.title: How 'dominant' Maguire helped Man Utd beat Liverpool
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given analyses Harry Maguire's dominance in Manchester United's 2-1 win over Liverpool in the Premier League.

items.title: Tel Aviv derby called off by police after 'violent riots'
items.summary: The derby between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Hapoel Tel Aviv is cancelled before kick-off after police say "smoke grenades and pyrotechnic devices were thrown".

items.title: GB win two more world golds on final day
items.summary: Great Britain win two more gold medals on the final day of action at the Para-cycling Track World Championships in Rio de Janeiro.

items.title: 'It's ego' - top-heavy recruitment has left Liverpool 'disjointed'
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Troy Deeney discusses why Liverpool's summer recruitment has led to them becoming "disjointed" in their run of four straight defeats in all competitions.

items.title: Aspinall wins third European event of season
items.summary: Nathan Aspinall says he has "found the formula" after becoming the fifth player to win three European titles in the same season.

items.title: Brown stuns world champion Zhao at NI Open
items.summary: Antrim's Jordan Brown caused a major upset on the opening day of the Northern Ireland Open with a 4-0 win over world champion Zhao Xintong.

items.title: Ex-Real Madrid & Everton winger Drenthe suffers stroke
items.summary: Former Real Madrid and Everton winger Royston Drenthe is in hospital after suffering a stroke.

items.title: Brandy Explains Abrupt Exit From Stage at Chicago Concert WithÂ Monica
items.summary: Brandy released a statement online the day after the Oct. 18 show on the singers' joint The Boy Is Mine Tour.
items.body: Brandy made an unexpected exit from the stage Saturday night (Oct. 18) at Chicago’s United Center, where she was performing with Monica on the singers’ co-headlining The Boy Is Mine Tour. While she made it through most of the show, her abrupt departure meant fans didn’t get to hear the pair’s signature duet “The Boy Is Mine,” a hit that topped the Billboard Hot 100 songs chart for 13 weeks in 1998. On Sunday, Brandy explained that her early exit was due to a medical concern. She posted a full statement on Instagram . Related Brandy & Monica Announce ‘The Boy Is Mine’ Co-Headlining Tour With Kelly Rowland, Muni Long & Jamal Roberts: All the Dates “To my dear fans in Chicago,” Brandy wrote, “Thank you all for the overwhelming love, support, andâ€”most importantlyâ€”your prayers. I sincerely apologize for the abrupt end to last nightâ€™s performance in Chicago. After weeks of nonstop rehearsals, last night I experienced dehydration and feelings of wanting to faint. Everyone involved agreed that prioritizing my well-being was of the utmost importance.” “I still made the decision to try and return and â€¦

items.title: Amorim's big moment - are Man Utd finally ready for lift off?
items.summary: Finally, at Anfield, home of Manchester United's - historically and statistically - biggest rivals, Ruben Amorim's team delivered a statement win.

items.title: How to Watch â€˜the Roadâ€™ Season Premiere onÂ DIRECTV
items.summary: Tune in on October 19 to see which lucky contestant will be the opening act for Keith Urban.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Have you ever wondered what it would be like to be the opening act for your favorite musician? Well, 12 emerging musicians get the chance to live that dream on the season premiere of the Road . The new CBS reality TV series features a group of contestants competing as opening acts for legendary country music star Keith Urban on his national tour. Created by Blake Shelton and Taylor Sheridan, the season will premiere on CBS on October 19. Throughout the season, each singer will join a headliner on tour and perform as their opening act in venues across the country, attempting to win over local fanbases to secure a spot in the next city and remain on the tour. If they donâ€™t bring their best performance, they will be sent home. Hereâ€™s how you can tune into the premiere live online with DIRECTV . How to Watch the Road Season 1 on DIRECTV A subscription to DIRECTV â€” which comes with CBS to watch the Road â€” gets you access to live TV, local networks such aâ€¦

items.title: 'Liverpool blip now becomes something deeper'
items.summary: The problems are piling up for Liverpool head coach Arne Slot as Manchester United inflict their fourth successive loss, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

items.title: Sharon Osbourne Mourns Loss of Beloved Rescue Dog Elvis: â€˜He Gave Me 14 PreciousÂ Yearsâ€™
items.summary: Her pet's passing comes nearly three months after the death of her husband, Ozzy.
items.body: Sharon Osbourne is mourning the loss of her beloved dog, Elvis. On Sunday (Oct. 19), the 72-year-old television personality and longtime wife and manager of the late Ozzy Osbourne took to Instagram to share a heartfelt message honoring her loyal companion. Related Sharon Osbourne Breaks Silence Following Ozzy Osbourneâ€™s Death: ‘Still Having Trouble Finding the Words’ Ozzy Osbourne Pays Tribute to Beloved Dog Rocky: ‘I’ll See You on the Other Side My Friend’ Ozzy Osbourne Mourned by PETA for His ‘Gentle Side,’ Four Decades After Infamous Bat Incident “I canâ€™t believe I am posting this but my darling Elvis passed away this week,” she wrote alongside a carousel of photos featuring the Siberian Husky. “He gave me 14 precious years. He was by my side until the end. Rest in peace my darling boy!” Elvis was adopted by Sharon and Ozzy and became a cherished member of their large family of animals, which over the years has included dogs, cats, and even rescue pigs. The Siberian Husky was often seen curled up in Sharonâ€™s lap during interviews, TMZ reports. Elvisâ€™s passing comes nearly a year after the Osbourne â€¦

items.title: Rams charge to win over Jags despite Hunter score
items.summary: Travis Hunter scores his first NFL touchdown but it is merely a consolation as the Los Angeles Rams brush off jet lag to claim a 35-7 win over the Jacksonville Jaguars at Wembley.

items.title: England hold nerve for most significant win of Edwards era
items.summary: England's win over India in the Women's World Cup was the most important of the Charlotte Edwards era because of the way they handled pressure, says Ffion Wynne.

items.title: No Farrell or Willis in 36-man England training squad
items.summary: There is no place for Owen Farrell or Tom Willis in the 36-man England training squad before the autumn internationals.

items.title: Villa fight back to win at Tottenham
items.summary: Aston Villa fight back from a goal down to beat Spurs 2-1 at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

items.title: Maguire heads Man Utd to victory against Liverpool
items.summary: Harry Maguire heads Manchester United to a 2-1 win against Liverpool - their first victory at Anfield since 2016.

items.title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜The Life of a Showgirlâ€™ Spends Second Week Atop BillboardÂ 200
items.summary: Plus: Olivia Deanâ€™s "The Art of Loving" hits a new high in the top 10.
items.body: Taylor Swift â€™s The Life of a Showgirl spends a second week atop the Billboard 200 albums chart (dated Oct. 25), with 338,000 equivalent album units earned in the United States in the week ending Oct. 16, according to Luminate. Thatâ€™s down 92% compared to the albumâ€™s modern-era-record debut with 4.002 million units a week ago. Showgirl â€™s second week is the fifth-largest week of 2025 for any album. Further, itâ€™s the largest second week for any album since Swiftâ€™s last project, The Tortured Poets Department , earned 439,000 in its sophomore frame (May 11, 2024, chart). Showgirl is only the third album to spend its first two weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 in 2025, following Morgan Wallen â€™s Iâ€™m the Problem (its first eight) and Playboi Carti â€™s MUSIC (two). Showgirl leads a sleepy top 10 on the latest Billboard 200, where no albums debut in the region. Within the top 10, Olivia Dean â€™s The Art of Loving hits a new peak, rising 7-6 in its third week on the chart. Itâ€™s only the third album this year to debut in the top 10 and climb to a new high after its opening week. The Billboard 200 chart ranks the most popular albums of the week in the U.S. based on multi-metric consumption â€¦

items.title: Domingo Returns to â€˜SNLâ€™ as Sabrina Carpenter Parodies Taylor Swiftâ€™s â€˜The Fate of Opheliaâ€™:Â Watch
items.summary: The singer also performed her Manâ€™s Best Friend tracks â€œManchildâ€ and â€œNobodyâ€™s Sonâ€ during the Oct. 18 episode.
items.body: Domingo is back! During the cold open of Saturday Night Live ‘s Oct. 18 episode, Marcello Hernandez reprised his recurring role as Domingo in a musical skit alongside host and musical guest Sabrina Carpenter . Related Sabrina Carpenter Drops F-Bomb, Dances in Underwear While Performing ‘Manchild’ & ‘Nobodyâ€™s Son’ on ‘SNL’: Watch Sabrina Carpenter Jokes About ‘Man’s Best Friend’ Cover in Raunchy ‘SNL’ Monologue: Watch Sam Rivers, Limp Bizkit Co-Founder & Bassist, Dies at 48 In the six-minute sketch, titled “Domingo Cold Open,” Chloe Finemanâ€™s character Kelsey throws a birthday party for her husband Matthew (played by Andrew Dismukes). To celebrate, she enlists her girl squad to perform a surprise musical number, complete with modern pop parodies, about a recent Nashville trip to buy his gift. Things quickly unravel when Kelseyâ€™s friends â€” played by Carpenter, Sarah Sherman, Ashley Padilla and Veronika Slowikowska â€” launch into parodies of Taylor Swift â€™s “The Fate of Ophelia” and Lady Gaga â€™s “Abracadabra,” revealing that Kelsey spent a night with Domingo during â€¦

items.title: Ryde retains British Superbike Championship title
items.summary: Kyle Ryde becomes the first rider to win back-to-back British Superbike Championship titles since Shane Byrne in 2017 at Brands Hatch.

items.title: England beat India by four runs to seal semi-final spot

items.title: Lorde Brings Out Charli XCX to â€˜Work it Out on the Remixâ€™ at Ultrasound Tourâ€™s L.A.Â Stop
items.summary: The iconic duo performed their remix of â€œGirl, So Confusingâ€ to cap off Lordeâ€™s electric headlining set at the Kia Forum.
items.body: Lorde brought the raw intensity of her Ultrasound World Tour to Los Angelesâ€™ Kia Forum on Saturday (Oct.18), capping off a night of catharsis with special guest Charli XCX and their confessional Brat remix. The iconic duo previously performed their remix of â€œGirl, So Confusingâ€ during Charli and Troye Sivanâ€™s Sweat Tour stop at New Yorkâ€™s Madison Square Garden last September, as well as during Charliâ€™s Coachella set in April. But this was the first time that Lorde was in the driverâ€™s seat, inviting out Charli during her encore set at the Forum. â€œCan I trust you?â€ Lorde asked the crowd from a b-stage in the middle of the 18,000-person capacity arena before pulling out a Sharpie and writing â€œGIRLâ€ on her palm. The audience immediately understood the significance of that single word, going wild as Lordeâ€™s hand was projected on screen and the familiar hook of â€œGirl, So Confusingâ€ began to play alongside teaser shots of Charli. The Brat star then arrived, making her way across the floor of the Forum while powerfully delivering her opening verse about the strains of female friendship. Lorde writhed and danced on the b-stage and then launched into her own verse, recorded for the songâ€™s vâ€¦

items.title: England edge past India in thriller to reach semis
items.summary: Heather Knight's masterful century sets up a gripping four-run win for England over co-hosts India at the Women's World Cup, that sees them into the semi-finals.

items.title: Greaves wins 86th successive Women's Series match
items.summary: Beau Greaves extends her remarkable winning run in the PDC Women's Series to 86 matches with victory in the final four tournaments of the season.

items.title: Slade stars as Exeter crush Harlequins in Prem
items.summary: England centre Henry Slade scores two tries and kicks 13 points as Exeter continue their resurgence with a 38-0 Prem win over Harlequins.

items.title: Sabrina Carpenter Drops F-Bomb, Dances in Underwear While Performing â€˜Manchildâ€™ & â€˜Nobodyâ€™s Sonâ€™ on â€˜SNLâ€™: Watch
items.summary: The pop star also hosted the Oct. 18 episode.
items.body: Sabrina Carpenter brought music from her latest album, Manâ€™s Best Friend , to Saturday Night Live , pulling double duty as both host and musical guest on Oct. 18. The 26-year-old pop star delivered two standout performances from her seventh studio album, which debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 in September. Related Sabrina Carpenter Jokes About ‘Man’s Best Friend’ Cover in Raunchy ‘SNL’ Monologue: Watch Domingo Returns to ‘SNL’ as Sabrina Carpenter Parodies Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’: Watch Sam Rivers, Limp Bizkit Co-Founder & Bassist, Dies at 48 For her first performance, Carpenter appeared in a dimly lit bedroom set, wearing nothing but a white T-shirt and pink SNL -branded underwear. She danced around the stage while performing Manâ€™s Best Friend â€™s lead single â€œManchild,â€ which topped the Billboard Hot 100 chart in late June. Later in the episode, Carpenter returned in a bedazzled white karate gi and black belt for a dojo-themed performance of the reggae-pop track â€œNobodyâ€™s Son.â€ During the high-energy number, she dropped two F-bombs live on air while smashing wooden boards and knocking downâ€¦

items.title: Bouncy balls, points gaps & Honda Civics - inside Celtic's dismal day
items.summary: BBC Scotland examines what was a day of incident for defending Scottish champions Celtic at Dundee.

items.title: Sabrina Carpenter Jokes About â€˜Manâ€™s Best Friendâ€™ Cover in Raunchy â€˜SNLâ€™ Monologue:Â Watch
items.summary: The pop star pulled double duty as both host and musical guest on Oct. 18.
items.body: Sabrina Carpenter leaned into her provocative image while pulling double duty as host and musical guest on Saturday Night Live . During her opening monologue on Saturday (Oct. 18), the 26-year-old pop star addressed the buzz around the cover of her latest album, Man’s Best Friend , which shows her on all fours with an unseen person tugging her hair. Related Sabrina Carpenter Drops F-Bomb, Dances in Underwear While Performing ‘Manchild’ & ‘Nobodyâ€™s Son’ on ‘SNL’: Watch Domingo Returns to ‘SNL’ as Sabrina Carpenter Parodies Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’: Watch Sam Rivers, Limp Bizkit Co-Founder & Bassist, Dies at 48 â€œLast time I was here, for the 50th anniversary, I got to sing with Paul Simon, and since then my new album Manâ€™s Best Friend came out,â€ Carpenter told the audience. â€œSome people got a little freaked out by the cover. Iâ€™m not sure why. Itâ€™s just this.â€ The “Manchild” singer then pulled up an image of the controversial cover on the screen, revealing a few added images to give it full context. “But what people donâ€™t realize itâ€™s just how they cropped it,” sheâ€¦

items.title: Sam Rivers, Limp Bizkit Co-Founder & Bassist, Dies atÂ 48
items.summary: Rivers is remembered as "a once-in-a-lifetime kind of human" in an emotional tribute from the band.
items.body: Sam Rivers, longtime bass player and a founding member of Limp Bizkit , has died. He was 48. The band (Fred Durst, Wes Borland, John Otto and DJ Lethal) revealed the news of Rivers’ death Saturday night (Oct. 18) in a tribute to the musician titled “In Loving Memory of Our Brother, Sam Rivers,” in a post on Instagram . “Today we lost our brother. Our bandmate. Our heartbeat,” Limp Bizkit wrote on Saturday of Rivers, who was born in Jacksonville, Florida, in 1977 and was one third of the original formation of Limp Bizkit in 1994, alongside vocalist Durst and drummer Otto. (Borland and DJ Lethal joined in 1996.) “Sam Rivers wasnâ€™t just our bass player â€” he was pure magic,” his band members said. “The pulse beneath every song, the calm in the chaos, the soul in the sound. From the first note we ever played together, Sam brought a light and a rhythm that could never be replaced. His talent was effortless, his presence unforgettable, his heart enormous.” Their statement continued: “We shared so many moments â€” wild ones, quiet ones, beautiful ones â€” and every one of them meant more because Sam was there. He was a once-in-a-lifeâ€¦

items.title: Sabrina Carpenter Teases Tonightâ€™s â€˜SNLâ€™ in Behind-the-Scenes Photos
items.summary: The star pulls double duty as host and musical guest Saturday night (Oct. 18).
items.body: With just hours to go until Sabrina Carpenter takes over SNL , the singer reminded fans to tune with an Instagram post full of backstage snapshots. “TONIGHT,” Carpenter captioned her photo post , tagging @nbcsnl and topping it off with a red lips emoji. The pics give viewers a glimpse at her dressing room and outfit options. There’s also a peek at what looks to be a table read or writing session, and at the actual cue card that was used filming this week’s promo spot — all at SNL ‘s 30 Rock headquarters in New York City. Related Sabrina Carpenter Confesses Her ‘Greatest Fear’ in ‘SNL’ Promos — And It’s <em>Exactly</em> the Same as Marcello Hernandez’s Saturday night (Oct. 18) marks Carpenter’s first time hosting SNL , and her return as musical guest. The “Manchild” hitmaker performed during a May 2024 episode and was featured on February 2025’s SNL50 special, for which she sang a duet with Paul Simon and co-starred in one of Marcello Hernandez’s “Domingo” sketches. (She’d already had a run-in with Domingo at one of her concerts on the Short n&#8â€¦
